result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Arturego Isiakpere #238202 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per signed Order from Judge Edward F. Vlack amend sentence credit.

-Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. 
-Consecutive to 13CF353.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to:

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF50.
Bond to apply to DNA surcharge.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-Domestic Abuse Assessment.
-Cooperate with any assessment, evaluation or program as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-No Abusive Contact with Courtney Brendalen.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Random UA's and PBT's. 
-Complete Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-DNA Sample.
AODA to be completed within 30 days.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to 13CF353.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to:

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Patrick Arturego Isiakpere appeared from jail. Agent O'Keefe is also present. Includes 13CF353 and 14CF50. Case called at 1:51 pm. Court reviews file. There are questions re: PSI. S/T Agent O'Keefe. Court questions. Atty Perrin questions. ADA Nieskes questions. Atty Perrin questions Defendant re: withdrawing plea. Defendant wishes to continue. ADA Nieskes makes recommendations. Atty Perrin responds. Defendant makes statement. Recess. Recalled at 3:51 pm. Court orders:
On 14CF50:
18 months i/c, 30 months e/s
- Court Costs
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Restitution to be set at hearing
- AODA to be completed within 30 Days
- Domestic Abuse Assessment
- Psychological and Psychiatric Evaluation 
- Cooperate with any assessment, evaluation and program as directed by Agent
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- No Abusive contact with C. Brendalen
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Complete Cognitive Behavior Therapy
- Follow all rules and regulations of supervising agent
- Pay supervision fees
Consecutive to 13CF353

13CF353
Counts 5 and 6 concurrent to each other
- 7 months Jail.
- Credit for time served; 208 Days

Defendant is eligible fir Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Michael E Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Shirlene R Perrin   DF:  Patrick Arturego Isiakpere appeared from jail. Includes 13CF353 and 14CF50. Case called at 3:47 pm. There is an agreement.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Counts #5 and #6 in 13CF353, and Count #1 in 14CF50. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty on Counts #5 and #6 in 13CF353 and Count #1 in 14CF50. Counts #1, #2, #3, #4, #7 and #8 in 13CF353 are dismissed. Court orders COMPAS to be done. Bond remains. km  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
